column4: When I install VirtualBox it gives me the KDE look & feel on Gnome
and If i install Virtualbox-ose then its fine what could be the problem?
that's because it's a Qt app.

no problem really, it's probably just that virtualbox-ose, being an ubuntu package, is compiled to try to use a theme that better matches your GNOME desktop (while still being a Qt app), while on the other hand the VirtualBox you download elsewhere is just a statically linked binary.
yes, i'm here, but i haven't been able to beat the world record of typing speed yet
thank you for the response :) I got worried if some one would reply or not
any way, is there any package available for UBUNTU ? which should have a gnome look & feel?
i don't know, but what's wrong with virtualbox-ose to begin with?
no I  want to access my Pocket PC using ActiveSync from windows
you do know there are tools available to access your Pocket PC straight from Ubuntu?
but that doesn't support all the features, I would like to connect through GPRS to my laptop
there is a QGTKStyle which provides the native look and feel for QT applications in Gnome but that is still in LAB :(
there are instructions here https://help.ubuntu.com/community/PortableDevices/WindowsMobile for using a Windows device as a wireless modem
